name: NewYorker
text: “I’m super-­pleased when white people like my work, or are interested in it, or provoked by it,” the artist and filmmaker Arthur Jafa says. “But I’m talking to Black people, not to everybody.” https://t.co/JznD2OKp9K

name: NewYorker
text: Netflix’s recent programming, like “Emily in Paris” and "Dream Home Makeover," is an artifact of contemporary dystopia: a numbing backdrop to the rest of our digital consumption. https://t.co/daSMVbwQF7
